intro: Spuriopimpinella arguta, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear or narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Spuriopimpinella arguta is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial.
